metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13723 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Use after free in WebBluetooth in Google Chrome prior to 78.0.3904.108allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process topotentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13723` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 78.0.3904.108-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 78.0.3904.108-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 78.0.3904.108-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 78.0.3904.108-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 78.0.3904.108-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.3904.108-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
